content.question: Assume that a 2 percent increase in the price of bologna causes a 5 percent decrease in the demand for cheese. What is the cross-price elasticity of demand between the two goods, and how are these goods related?

choices.label: Cross-price elasticity of demand equals <math alttext="negative 0.4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>0.4</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and these goods are complements.
Cross-price elasticity of demand equals <math alttext="positive 0.4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mn>0.4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and these goods are substitutes.
Cross-price elasticity of demand equals <math alttext="negative 2.5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2.5</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and these goods are complements.
